Reviews.Title: “nasty, scary”
Reviews.Author: threesisters_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend with my sisters. We almost never found it. Poorly labeled. When we finally arrived, we thought, "wow, this is nice". We were wrong! Apparently, you have to purchase the "indoor water park" to get the nice rooms. Our room was in a whole other building. The bathroom was not clean. The beds were horrible. The pillows were even worse. The shower was an experience! We came home one night from shopping all day to find that our door was WIDE OPEN!! Apparently, the cleaning crew left it open. I know they were there because we had clean towels and the beds were made up. Anyone could have come in and hid in the bathroom! It was a little scary. We called the front desk, but apparently it was no big deal to them. We paid $180 for this! Won't happen again!

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: americangirl08
Reviews.Content: office and breakfast area too far from room. room nothing special. breakfast nothing special. would not recommend. this used to be a nice place with friendly staff but now that it is owned by a resort will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: adams3804
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this hotel. The pillows are paper thin with an uncomfortable mattress. In the shower, there was this dispenser for soap for your hair and body. The hotel advertises their full hot breakfast.....well.... the biscuits were hard, the little sausages were soggy seemed like they were microwaved and they offered one type of juice...orange...not a big selection. My husband and I ate once there and that was enough during our 4 day stay. The room temperature was hard to maintain...we either burned up or froze. We will not stay here again!!! The Adams Family

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: arkietoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Room compares to a Motel 6. First morning there were ants on the sink. They were in the sugar packet for the coffee. Cheap dispenser on the shower wall for dispensing liquid soap for body and HAIR! Breakfast was nothing special unless you like biscuits and gravy. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: jculin
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok, a little small for a family of 5. Front desk staff was very helpful with directions and ideas where to eat and what to do. Only disappointing thing, the pool was across the street at a different hotel. I didn't like sending my children to cross the high traffic street to go to the pool. Otherwise nice accomodations and great breakfast. If you want to save money for a big family.

Reviews.Title: “shop around”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Tulsa
Reviews.Content: After some reasearch I decided to book 2 rooms for our family vacation at the Atrium. After seeing the rooms, I had a hunch that I should've shopped around a little more. Those are the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in. Plus, the shower head hit me right in the chest so I had to get on my knees to wash my hair. The bathroom really dated the place....early 1960's. The kids liked the breakfast, but the foam in the pitcher told me that was powdered milk so I stayed away. I kind of like a place to relax with my family when I'm not running around and this wasn't it. My wife and I stopped by 5 or 6 places before we left and took a look at the rooms. We found much better hotels for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Reasonable, A No Frills Stay, Served its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: thefrisk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay there on our wedding anniversary. We got a room with a king size bed and whirlpool (next to night stand). Our room was at the lower level in the back. There was no parking created for those on this side of the building, so we had to park on the opposite side. We walked down stairs towards our room. The numbering of room levels was a little confusing. In the room you could hear construction and some traffic noise at times. The room itself had a slight odor, probably from water damage which was evident from the warped bottom of night stand next to the bed. The shower was a stand up model with a liquid soap dispenser. The toilet seat was squeaky when you raised it. There was a sink, small fridge and microwave, all worked. The window air conditioner made the room cold fast. The king size bed was comfortable. The lobby looked new and the free breakfast was good. (staff was friendly). We had juice, milk, scrambled eggs, hot biscuits and gravy. For the price of $80 plus dollars a night it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “The Atrium is a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: bafrog
Reviews.Content: After a horrible night at another hotel up the road and several nights camping it was very comforting to arrive at such a nice hotel. The folks at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean with everything in order, even had extra towels for the kids. After a restful night of sleep we went to the lobby and found a great hot breakfast of eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, cereal, sliced peaches, coffee, milk, and OJ. This is what a hotel breakfast should be. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends, and the next time we go back to Branson, we will stay at this hotel. It is off the main drag but easy to get where you want to go. A+

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: romantictraveler2
Reviews.Content: It was hard to tell if we would be disappointed when we chose this place to spend our anniversary. We came by it through a time-share freebie in Branson and the other places we could choose from were riskier options according to what we could find on the internet. But we were pleasantly surprised by the clean, spacious, newly remodeled jacuzzi room we upgraded to for a mere $25, which was $20 less than what the time share people wanted for an upgrade. There were only a handful of other cars in the parking lot. We parked right outside our door. The front desk was very responsive and accomodating, except for the refusal to give us 2 inroom coffee packets for the inroom single coffee maker. For $25 we got a microwave, small fridge and clean, romantic 2 person jacuzzi. The carpet was clean with an iron imprint near the bathroom door. The was a separate shower. There was a crack in the side of the jacuzzi tile and the door lock which had just been changed out would not take the card or a replacement card. They finally gave us a key. The free 'continental' breakfast from the hotel was a buffet across the street at Dockers Restaurant, I assume due to the few patrons the hotel had while we were there. The maid was likewise friendly, and got us the extra coffee we had requested. Another review to add here for those interested in a show. Stay away from "spirit of the dance" unless you do not mind recorded tap routines. We were disappointed that the dancers were not tapping out their impressive choreography live... it was all recorded. For a hair salon, go to "Curl up and dye" at the Victorian village on Shepard of the Hills (red route) Good service and prices and massage also.

Reviews.Title: “Stay o.k.”
Reviews.Author: bigbopper26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October. Overall our stay was good. The breakfast was outstanding! The only problem we had was the bathtub drain was real slow and the toilet stopped up in the adjoining room. When I told them they acted like they already knew it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: graymace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and it was just right for what we needed. Clean room, friendly service, good price and a nice breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ashmmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium in for 3 nights. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. They had a full breakfast- eggs, biscuits, gravy, sasuage, and muffins... Aslo had peaches and assorted cereals. Locally owned and operated, great staff! We had the convenience of joined rooms... could easily get from room to room without going outside... Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our four day stay at the Atrium. The courteous and helpful staff were just like members of our own family. We are planning to stay there again this summer. They were so helpful and knowledgeable about area attractions. I was also told they have added more rooms and a waterpark to their property!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Branson and stayed at the Atrium Inn. The hotel rooms were very clean and one included a microwave and refrigerator, without request. The breakfast on Sunday morning was good and our plates were taken away by staff members before we could throw them away ourselves. The breakfast bar was kept very tidy and stocked. The BEST thing was the speedy check-in. Within three minutes of arriving at the hotel, I had room keys in hand. The check-out was very quick as well, leaving more time to enjoy Branson. The staff was very courteous and were very helpful in providing information on where to eat dinner. I would definitely stay at the Atrium Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: loveineurope
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms aren't very big we found that we had everything we needed at the Atrium Inn. The rooms were clean and we were surprised by the nice jacuzzi tub. The nicest thing about this place is that the owners/managers were very friendly and made you feel welcomed! The hot breakfast was a nice change from the usual cold stale donuts. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No hair dryer. Office doesn't open until 7am. Coffee pot/plug in didn't work. Air conditioner didn't work. No one to call about any problems because there is no one in the office until 7am. When we told them of the problems, they didn't offer to make any adjustment in our bill and it cost $70/night. I don't know where these other people got their prices!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night visit at the Atruim Inn. I was there July 25, 26, and 27, 2004. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated. There was just my husband and I, but they supplied four large bath towels, hand towels and wash cloths, and of good quality. There was a coffee pot in the room with coffee supplied. They kept the room clean daily, with replacement of all towels. We did not have to ask for anything. There was also a complimentary breakfast...biscuits and gravey, scrambled eggs, sausage, juice, cereal, and coffee. They also have a nice pool area in rear. We had plenty of parking spaces to choose from, the parking is as large as most motels that I noticed in the area. Do not be afraid of this motel it was very nice and we were treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Branson, Mo for 10 days, we stayed at the Atrium Inn it was a very nice motel, the only problem we had was when came home at night we had to park away from our room, other wise great. The food was good, people very friendly, and polite had no trouble getting on to the streets, only real disapointment was the train ride, to much money for nothing. All you could see was trees!!!! Other than that I'm going back again, and again!!!! I thought that I would turn into biscuits and gravy it was so good that I had it every day. Dicks 5&10 was great too, the ducks, and all the talent I couldn't believe how talented everyone was. All great shows, I wish we could of stayed longer. We also seen Kenny Rogers and Charley Pride they were great too. We loved it there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a quick trip to Branson. We stayed at the Atrium Inn. The place has been completely re-done. We ate the FREE HOT breakfast every morning, and it was wonderful. Pam, who is one of the owners, is absolutely OUTSTANDING. The rooms were spotless and the Inn's location on Green Mountain Drive was great. We got to all our shows in minutes, without having to navigate the traffic on Hwy 76. This is one place we will stay at again .....

Reviews.Title: “The Atrium Inn is under new ownership...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Branson, MO last week and drove by the Atrium Inn. We liked what we saw, so we stopped in. The place was FANTASTIC. The NEW OWNERS have completely RENOVATED the place. It seems that the OLD owners hired a management company to run the Inn, and it appears from the PREVIOUS COMMENTS that they did not do a very good job. So GO AHEAD and stay at the ATRIUM INN. The new owners are ALSO the managers and THEY CARE about their guests. The Atrium Inn offers a FREE Deluxe HOT BREAKFAST with all their rooms. All rooms are now NON-SMOKING. They also have a 100 person community room that this is FREE to use for all groups booking 10 or more rooms.

Reviews.Title: “WORST PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel on july 7th of 2003 till july 11th of 2003. the parking was horriable. they ran out of room for people to park every night. my view outside of the room was a sewer. when i got to my room the room was dirty and there was no one there to clean it up. they say they have stamps to mail your post cards out, but they never did, and they sent you to a place that never carried them. the towels are white with red stains on them. there was 4 of us to the room but they seems to never give us more then 3 towels. i always had to go to the lobby to get more. they wouldn't bring them to your room. i was in the lobby getting my room and the phone just kept ringing and ringing and the receptionist said she couldn't do more than 2 things at once and that they would have to call back. no one wants to answer the phones at night. it just rings and rings. my daughter got hurt and had to get stitches in her mouth and no one seemed to care. when i complained and reserve branson complained they didn't want to do anything about it or refund any of my money. they said oh well. the cleaning ladies come knocking on your door at 9:00 a.m. asking you to leave. the location is the only thing great about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium was just fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Atrium was an OK place to stay. It was very easily accessed off the strip. It was clean. We liked the refrigerator in the room. The continental breakfast was above average. We were well satisfied.

HotelInfo.Name: Atrium Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3005 Green Mountain Drive, Branson, MO 65616
